fields.description:
Sometimes the SC fails to find a valid attachment token for a volume and thus fails to attach it. 

In cloud output on the SC: 

2013-08-22 17:50:52  INFO | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.2.0.109 finished.
2013-08-22 17:50:57  INFO | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.2.0.110 finished.
2013-08-22 17:50:57  INFO | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.2.0.110 finished.
2013-08-22 17:51:02  INFO | Processing GetVolumeToken request for volume vol-E55B3D45
2013-08-22 17:51:02  INFO | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.2.0.109 finished.
2013-08-22 17:51:02  INFO | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.2.0.109 finished.
2013-08-22 17:51:03  INFO | Processing ExportVolume request for volume vol-E55B3D45
2013-08-22 17:51:03  WARN | Got request for attachment token, no valid token found for volume  vol-E55B3D45
2013-08-22 17:51:03 ERROR | Error checking for valid attachment token
com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: No valid token found
	at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.cloud.entities.VolumeInfo.getAttachmentTokenIfValid(VolumeInfo.java:264)
	at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.BlockStorage$2.apply(BlockStorage.java:448)
	at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.BlockStorage$2.apply(BlockStorage.java:442)
	at com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities$TransactionalFunction.apply(Entities.java:1050)


This seems to happen out of the blue, roughly once every 200 attachments. I encountered this problem while running a eutester script that would create an instance, a volume, attach the volume to the instance, write some data to the attached volume, make a snapshot of the volume, detach it, create a new volume from the snapshot and attach the snapshot to read the previously written data. Rinse and repeat.

Attached are all of the logs on the system when an instance of this error occurred (look for the entries around the time "2013-08-22 17:51:03"), along with the conf files on each machine.
fields.summary: Failed to find valid attachment token (SC)
fields.environment: 3 computers, CLC/Walrus on machine A, CC/SC on machine B and NC on machine C. All three machines were connected to a router by Ethernet and the router had no other computers connected to it (no wireless either), so I think that rules out network delay between the CLC and SC.

comments.body: This is a timing issue and happens infrequently. Zach will attempt to reproduce, but this may not make it into 3.4.0, if we cannot reproduce easily.

It looks like this may be the result of a failed db commit that is not causing the response to be aborted to the client. I have a fix that will properly catch the exception and not return a token to the client unless the db commit completes successfully
Going to run a churn test over the weekend for attach/detach and see if we can expose the error in the fixed code. More info on Monday.

Fixed a suspected DB commit failure. Unable to completely verify that this resolved the issue but ran a EBS-volume churn on my test setup that ran 1019 iterations without failure. No indication of the token invalid issue on the NC. Also checked for db commit errors on the SC and found none, no indications of receiving invalid Volume Tokens.

If we see this issue come up again we can re-open the ticket. I can't be 100% sure this change fixed the issue but it does fix a possible source of similar failures. It ensures that a db commit exception will not get swallowed and allow the token (now not in the db) to be returned to the CLC. The attachment should fail outright and be easily retry-able with no message reaching the NC.

Testing I did:
euca-sequence-3.3-dns + microQA EBS-churn suite for 2+ days (>1000 attach/detach cycles). No failures on attachment. Topology: single frontend + 1 NC. SC configured with DASManager.

Internal commit: 31230747e041d56d4473acec85993d23b288aa3a
Euca commit: 377e6f4b7a14954dc58a50b3ab9a24bf227f74c7

I'm re-opening this. In continued churn tests I found a similar failure. It looks like the write of the volume token to the db is successful but the lookup by the SC on the ExportVolume request from the NC is failing. Very infrequent, but want to keep track of it anyhow.
Note that this doesn't cause any problem (things in a bad state), you simply try again and the command goes through.

The fix for this is a simple retry (or 3) in the storage controller for token lookup. There appears to be a rare case where the token is committed but not found on subsequent lookups. A small back-off and retry in the SC should resolve the issue.
Should be able to get to this for 4.0. It is a quick fix--adding retry on lookup.
Fix is running through EBS-instance churn.

Internal commit: 556051f10ad7270c7af4843bb50820e13a314aa0
Eucalyptus commit: 0cd0088144b89ef26be95506821bbd7087190713

Adds a retry (3x) on token lookup during attachment to allow the db to fully flush. Not an ideal solution because I couldn't retry the entire transaction due to portions of the operation not being idempotent yet. A larger fix would make all portions of the export operation idempotent such that the entire operation can be retried as needed for partial failure cases.

I verified with a churn test and saw 2500 BfEBS run/terminate cycles without a failure. This bug, was hard to reproduce, however, so if it pops up again we can re-open this or file a new issue.
I ran a churn for over 24 hours and no "checking for valid attachment token" errors.
[~kedwards], any info on why this is reopened?
[~zhill] I was not able to reproduce this on another system. I will take a look at the db connection issues on that system on SC 10.49.

[~mmunn1]

Please open another bug that is tied to the failure you are seeing.
